course.subject: MATH
course.name: Mathematical Biology
course.description: Population, ecology, infectious disease, genetic, and biochemistry models. Additional topics chosen by instructor.
course.prerequisites: MATH 2121/MATH 2111/MATH 2131 and MATH 2351/MATH 2352; or MATH 2350

reviews.author: YS
reviews.comment_content:
Basically follows the content in the written lecture notes that you can found in Jeff's webpage.

I actually thought he can teach something about the DNA (Ch. 7), but maybe self-learning also matters.

By the way, the next time this class opens would probably be at least 2 years later.
reviews.comment_teaching:
1.5x playback and max volume is your friend. I got lucky the lectures were recorded.

But Jeff's quite easy going, letting us know what he's testing us in the final exam.

The TA is helpful, although she may not have enough understanding to the topics. She simply recap the class content and did not extract/explain the knowledge in her own way.
reviews.comment_grading: Maybe the class size is very small so Jeff uses absolute grading. Leave a comment if you are at the cut-offs. Quite nice to me because my work in the assignments (20%) and final exam (50%) pays off.
reviews.comment_workload:
4 assignments, each spans around 3 weeks. I need to start working on each assignment 1 week before the deadline so I can search the correct way to answer the problems in time, or ask the TA to give me some hints.

Both midterm & final are open everything by yourself, so after I screwed up in midterm, I needed to spend quite a lot of time in writing the framework of answering some previous problems, hoping it would be useful.

reviews.author: drinkmorewater
reviews.comment_content:
Population Dynamics
Age-structured Problems
Population Growth
Infectious Disease Modelling
Population Genetics
Biochemical Reactions

Jeff wrote his own lecture notes and can be found on his website.
Some contents can be found in his own Youtube channel.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Jeff talks very slow and for non English speaker it is very easy to understand complicated concepts. He can answer all of our questions and explain it clearly after class.
He derives every formulas and explain every meanings of the parameters. So it is very friendly for students with poor fundamental knowledge of math.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading
Jeff will teach you how to finish the homework if you don't know how to solve problems.
He will tell you the exact topics will be tested in midterms and exams.
Easy to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Have few weeks to finish one homework which problems are all similar to what he demonstrated in lectures.
